discussion: 1. Is the Internet making us, as a society, “stupid”? Cite your evidence and explain how you believe the Internet is or is not “making us stupid.”
2. Does the Internet affect the way you think? Have you noticed good or bad effects after being online? What effects and what were you doing online that you believe caused those effects?
3. How can we use the Internet responsibly? Give examples and explain why they are important.
action: 1. ReadNicholas Carr’soriginal pro argument atThe Atlantic.
2. Analyze comments by 11 experts on whether “constant use of digital technologies [are]affecting our brain health” atVox.

4. Consider how you felt about the issue before reading this article. After reading the pros and cons on this topic, has your thinking changed? If so, how? List two to three ways. If your thoughts have not changed, list two to three ways your better understanding of the “other side of the issue” now helps you better argue your position.
5. Push for the position and policies you support by writing US nationalsenatorsandrepresentatives.
